fields.description:
To avoid the {{C++}} problem, the {{<ins>}} and {{<del>}} can be supported.

----
On *January 8, 2014* (half year ago) I [made this comment in issue about supporting strikethrough text in Bitbucket issues|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4412/support-strikethrough-in-markdown-readme#comment-7643681] and then, five days later I [made another comment in the same issue|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4412/support-strikethrough-in-markdown-readme#comment-7703757]. In both cases (at a time of January) *both strikethrough and inserted text were working all fine and were rendered correctly*.

As I see now, support for inserted text *was removed*. When and why? Is this temporal or permanent? If this is permanent (for example, because of {{C++}} problem), then is it worth rising an issue for adding support for {{<ins>}} and {{<del>}} tags?
fields.summary: Add support for <ins> and <del> tags in markdown (BB-10872)

The issue seems to be the same as https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/9602/reported-repository-size-seems-wrong.

I think forced garbage collector need to run with repacking of repository to fix the message. Other users are also not able to clone the repository on low internet connection and getting message:

fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly fatal: index-pack failed error: RPC failed; result=56, HTTP code = 200

fields.description:
Trying to download a repository of ~3.5k files, 1GB packed. The download stops mid-way every single time, always at different stages of download completion. Trying to use a download manager ends up with a "request to server timed out" error. What's more, Bitbucket doesn't allow download resuming, so I have to start the download anew every time it happens (happened at 96.6% downloaded today, ARGHHH!)

Pulling from the repository using SourceTree yields the same result (the difference being it takes MUCH longer, between 15 minutes and an hour), with the following error:

fatal: early EOF

fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
fatal: index-pack failed

error: RPC failed; result=18, HTTP code = 200

I'm literally pulling my hair out at this. Please, does anybody know why it's so difficult to download from my repository???
fields.summary: Unable to download/pull from repository

fields.description:
As in title. When you edit milestone, version or component in repository (issue tracker) settings, sometimes you may end up with sudden remove of previously selected element.

At first, I thought, that this happens only on non-Latin characters (for example using correct "bēta", which requires UTF-8, in place of incorrect "beta"). But it turned out, that it could happen anytime. Simply edit some of your milestone, version or component, refresh page after successful edit and at some point you may end up with {{default}} setting being cleared.

Note: You must refresh page or change configuration section to another and back to current to notice this issue. Even, if {{default}} settings is removed after particular element edit, you won't notice this until next page refresh.

BTW: I'm marking this problem as "trivial", though I have a very bad feeling that fixing it won't be trivial for Bitbucket core dev team. [Adding {{delete}} link to auto-generated comments|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8725/an-ability-to-edit-and-delete-all-the] also sounded like trivial thing, but it turned out, that even after half of the year, you have failed to implement it. It seems, that there are no trivial things for you. Pity.
fields.summary: Editing existing milestone, version or component sometimes removes default setting (BB-10877)

fields.description:
It is beyond my imagination, why deletion of milestone, version or component is not confirmed by a dialog (the very same, that appears, when trying to delete issue or comment)?

For those, who thinks, that its not needed, because you can very easily recreate element deleted by an accident, here is the thing: Don't forget, that our bellowed Bitbucket developers have honored us with a feature, that ads idiotic {{Component removed}} (or similar) comment to *every issue* that had that accidentally deleted element. So, accidental delete of for example milestone, may in some occasion end up with generating of hundreds of useless comments to your issues. That's why such operation should be confirmed by any kind or form of dialog!

*To make things even worse, the very same, bellowed Bitbucket developers are failing to implement such simple feature, like [adding {{Delete}} link to this useless, auto-generated comments|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8725/]*. Believe it or not, they're struggling with this problem for past *HALF YEAR* and still haven't figured out anything!

*So (to Bitbucket team and others), YES, we NEED a confirmation dialog before deletion of milestone, version or component!*
fields.summary: Deletion of milestone, version or component should be confirmed with a dialog (BB-10869)

fields.description:
Repro steps:

# Go to the Deployment Keys settings page of a repo.
# Add a public SSH key as a Deployment Key.
# Add it again.
# Add it again.
# You now have the same deployment key on your repo 3 times.

Is this intended?
fields.summary: The same SSH key can be added as a Deployment Key multiple times to a single project. (BB-10868)

fields.description:
As in title and in screenshot below:

!1507465998-bbbug.png|thumbnail!

When {{An unexpected error occurred}} message appears, "please wait" loader does not stop spinning and {{Change}} button does not regain {{enabled}} state.

To retry operation, user must:

* copy entered text to clipboard,
* *refresh page*,
* click {{Resolve}},
* paste / enter reason again,
* again click {{Change}}.

Quite not convenient.

Note: refreshing page is a must. Clicking {{Cancel}} and {{Resolve}} again _without_ refreshing page, reopens dialog in the same, unusable state. Clicking {{Cancel}} button does not "reset" dialog to initial state, when error previously occured.
fields.summary: An unexpected error in resolving an issue does not re-enable "Change" button (BB-10865)

fields.description:
It's me again. This issue appeared few day ago but it was ok before.\\
On the repository overview page you have statistics block. At the Opera 12 browser you see stats block line up to single column while WebKit make it in two columns.

As usually solution is very simple.\\
You have the *#repo-overview #repo-stats .stats li* selector with *display: inline-block;* rule. It remains to add only *float: left;*.
fields.summary: Repo overview stats in Opera (BB-10844)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
Recently we got granted an academic license for Bitbucket for our technical highschool. Awesome. Now the preparation for next years turnus (beginning of september) starts, and I investigated the API a bit.

Unfortunately I was not able to find an API call to create a user.

So my question/proposal is/would be:

Are there any API calls to create users and teams based on dynamic dataset, which we will receive automatically from our student information management system? I would have to create initially a couple of hundret users and about 50 teams? Do I have to do this manually?

Thanks for any help/enlightment.

kind regards\\
Klaus
fields.summary: API calls to create users

fields.description:
Some issue comments contain only status changes (changed milestone, changed priority, edited description etc). Those comments are included in {{comment_count}} field in {{https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{owner}/{slug}/issues/{id}/}}.

Previously {{https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{owner}/{slug}/issues/{id}/comments/}} included those status change comments with {{contents=null}}. Now these messages are missing from response completely which causes {{comment_count}} to show higher values than there are real comments.

Related request from two years ago: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4259/add-status-changes-to-issue-comments
fields.summary: comment_count from issues/{id}/ does not match the number of items received from issues/{id}/comments/ (BB-10833)

fields.description:
git notes not appearing when viewing a commit message.

A colleague pushed a commit with no commit message.

Did a git notes add .... to attach a note about what the commit was,\\
then git push origin refs/notes/*

And when looking at the commit details in bitbucket, the notes are not shown.

Would be good to have them display.
fields.summary: Display git notes when viewing a commit message

fields.description:
Hi,

Some times when I try to create a branch in bitbucket i have an error "Invalid branch name".

!4001003844-Create%20a%20branch%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket.png|thumbnail!

But the branch have been created and if I click again the button I have the message "A branch with this name already exists"

!2793269293-Create%20a%20branch%20%E2%80%94%20Bitbucket-2.png|thumbnail!

This issue happened on every repos but it's not every time I try to create a branch.\\
It just happened on the repo ccmbenchmark/testrepo when trying to create the branch "preprod" from the master.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Invalid branch name but branch created (BB-10834)

fields.description:
Greeting.

I am trying to integrate BitBucket to Jenkins(jenkins server - CentOS4.3).\\
But it said my ssh-key is not correct.\\
!2862217328-bitbucket%20jenkins%20failed.png|thumbnail!\\
!2257227464-bitbucket%20link%20failed.png|thumbnail!

then i tried the same ssh-key on my github.\\
It could be connected successfully.\\
!108961160-github%20jenkins%20success.png|thumbnail!\\
!2677430438-github%20link%20succeed.png|thumbnail!

I don't know what's wrong with the bitbucket.org\\
Please help.\\
If it cannot solved. We have move our Repos to Github.
fields.summary: Jenkins to BitBucket

fields.description: We would like to setup a team wiki so everyone could contribute in.
fields.summary: Adding a wiki to team profile page

fields.description:
When you add a Hook without any configuration, e.g. Issues, it gets lost in space if you do the following:

# Select Issues from the dropdown
# Click Add
# Click Edit on a previous added Hook, e.g. Email
# Click Cancel in the dialog that pops up...

...now the added Issues hook takes a trip...

If you click Save in the dialog that pops up, the added Issues hook stays, or if you navigate away from the Hooks view and then return it also stays...
fields.summary: Hook with no configuration (e.g. Issues) lost in space... (BB-10826)

fields.description:
On every single page of Bitbucket, there isn't a single element or text that defines the current repo.

The only way to know the current repo is reading the URL on browser.\\
And if a user has several repos and don't have URL visible on browser, it can be nasty.

My proposal is to append the Repo Name along the Page Title, for example:

"MyRepo Issues"

"MySecondRepo Source"

and so on...
fields.summary: Add repository name on Page Title (BB-10829)

fields.description:
Hello,

On our repository, we have by example two directories :\\
berlin\\
Berlin\\
They both appear inside bitbucket.\\
When git clone, the berlin folder disappear and its content overwrite the one of Berlin.\\
Any idea ?

Julien
fields.summary: Weird case sensitivity issue
Hook POST missing branchs

fields.description:
Wiki pages have equal top and bottom margin and look pretty cool:

!4099512592-bb1.png|thumbnail!

Issues, though rendered from the same Markdown ({{# Header}}) have a _huge_ and _ugly_ top margin and look just terrific:

!1748410402-bb2.png|thumbnail!

What caused this difference? I'm pretty sure that not far than just a few weeks ago, both systems had the same styling. Why did you change this? Can this be reverted, so issue headers styling will be back the same as in Wiki pages.

_Note: I understand, that this might seems as trivial, irrelevant problem to most. But, since many of us are spending few hours each day with issues, aesthetic aspects also matters. Beside, why to change something, what was good?_
fields.summary: Differences in styling header between Wiki and Issues (BB-10832)

fields.description: When a comment gets deleted in some pull request it appears as "Pull request #[number] deleted in [branch]" in Recent activity log.
fields.summary: Inappropriate "Pull request deleted" message (BB-10827)

git remote add origin git@bitbucket.org:RyanHeung/bebi.vn.git
git push -u origin --all
{code}

fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

So what is my problem ? please help me !

fields.description:
For example, request on url *https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/Mingun/dreamkeepers-translation-history/filehistory/tip/Комментарии.md* (https://snap.apigee.com/VaRL6o) doesn't return correct response - it's empty. While request on url *https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/Mingun/dreamkeepers-translation-history/filehistory/tip/Readme.md* (https://snap.apigee.com/1jd8B9R) get correct response.

For this reason, this buttons does not work.

Also, do not work this link: https://bitbucket.org/Mingun/dreamkeepers-translation-history/full-commit/323ba124d01b/Комментарии.md with non-latin names.

fields.description:
Error :\\
Перейдите на вашу ветку\\
Эта ветка не содержит никаких изменений — перейдите к ней на своем *локольном* компьютере для продолжения работы.

Нужно исправить слово - локальном

P.S.\\
Опечатка в слове "локальном".\\
никаких - в приципе лишнее слово в данном предложении.\\
Как вариант перевода:\\
Перейдите в вашу ветку\\
Эта ветка не содержит изменений — перейдите в неё на своем *локальном*\\
компьютере для продолжения работы.
